title: It is sometimes thought that M.Crassus' silver mines were in Spain, where he certainly had connections (Plut. Crassus 2.5; F.Adcock, Marcus Crassus, millionaire

23, argues that Marius also owned mines in Spain, but this is very uncertain. C.Aquillius Gallus, the lawyer, a rich man, owned a property in the island of Cercina, off the coast of Africa, where Ser. Sulphicius in youth studied with him (Pomponius 43); Gallus was subsequently praetor, in 66, but may have entered the Senate late - Pliny, NH 17.2 calls him an eques Romanus.
